member.name: T:Unisys.ImageQuality.Phase2FstcMetrics
member.summary: Represents the measured metrics returned from Image Quality Processing.
member.remarks: The values in this class are set by the Image Quality library. While each of the properties have property setters, they are not meant to be called from user code, and are exposed to allow XML serialization to occur.

member.name: T:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult
member.summary: Specifies the aggregation of quality results.
member.remarks:
This structure is formatted as it is written in a tiff file by the unisys transports. It does not contain any semantic meaning for the image to which it is applied, therefore, it must be contained in an instance of or some other indexing collection to ensure that the proper results are matched to the proper image.
This structure contains instance fields that are public for serialization. They should be considered read only by an application, due to the fact that the image analysis software generates instances if this strucure.
The and (X9.37) values are obsolete and are remapped from the X9.100-180 (Phase 2) active and return values respectively. Because the remapping is not a one-to-one correlation, there is no method to obtain the thresholds that cause failure for phase 1 tests.
To determine whether a specific test was run for an item, you must examine the PhaseActive flags. If that value is 0, the result value is indeterminate (the test was not run). If the value is 1, the value in the return structure is valid. In this case, when the result bit is set, it means that the test failed (a problem detected), otherwise test passed

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult.Phase1Active
member.summary: Gets the flag tests that were run for this item.
member.remarks: These values are mapped from the member.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult.Phase1Return
member.summary: Gets the flag tests that failed the thresholding tests for this item.
member.remarks: These values are mapped from the member.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult.Phase2Active
member.summary: Gets the flag tests that were run for this item.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult.Phase2Return
member.summary: Gets the flag tests that failed the thresholding.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.QualityResult.Phase2FstcMetricValues
member.summary: Gets the metric values of the image used to compare against the thresholds to determine the test results.

member.remarks: This collection is keyed by objects, meaning that there is only one result allowed for each combination of image description members and values. This collection overrides the implementation of the to never use a dictionary for lookup

member.summary: This enumeration specifies Unisys Specfic tests that complement the X9.100-180 flag set. Currently the only test performed in software is

member.summary: Beam of light error.

member.summary: Hardware framing error

member.summary: Top of the image was truncated

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.UnisysPhase2Flags.BottomTruncated

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.UnisysPhase2Flags.PercentOfVerticalTransitions
member.summary: Vertical transition measurment exceeds threshold.

member.name: T:Unisys.ImageQuality.X9100Flags
member.summary: These flags represent the X9.100-180 tests that are available.
member.remarks:
This flag set is used to specify both the tests requested and the flags detected. X9.37/X9.100 specifies the following results:
Result value
Description
0 The test was not performed by the image processing software. When the flag value in the request is not set, this is the corresponding result.
1 The test was performed by the image processing software and the test failed (i.e. the conditions were met to set the flag that there is a problem). This is the result of ANDing the requested tests and result value.
2 The test was performed and no defect was detected. The tests with this value is an XOR of the request and result. Because there is no situation in which the test result bit is set while the test request bit is unset, an XOR of the two values will give you the correct value.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.X9100Flags.None
member.summary: No tests requested or no problems detected.

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.X9100Flags.UndersizeImage
member.summary: Undersize image detection (image too narrow or too short).

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.X9100Flags.ExcessiveDocumentSkew
member.summary: Image too skewed

member.name: F:Unisys.ImageQuality.X9100Flags.OversizeImage

member.name: M:Unisys.Imaging.InterchangeDescription.GetHashCode
member.summary: The hash code for an interchange description.
member.remarks: This hash code is a combination of all the image descriptions that are in the list.
member.returns: The hash code for the interchange description.

member.name: T:Unisys.Imaging.InterchangeDescriptionCollection
member.summary: Collection of interchange descriptions.
member.remarks: Derived class because two InterchangeImage descriptions are considered equal for keying if they contain the same side and image type. Note that you cannot use the int as the hash, because then the serialization would fail because the serializer would try to do bad things (conver the collection improperly).

member.name: M:Unisys.Imaging.InterchangeDescriptionCollection.InsertItem(System.Int32,Unisys.Imaging.InterchangeDescription)
member.summary: Overrides the collection's insertion to check to ensure that the same keys aren't added.
